definition: radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 4)/see 撇[pie3]

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace
to cast or put aside/to forget for a while
gloomy and dull (idiom)/boring and gray/unpleasantly murky

sentences.english: "I've lost her, " said the Prince, and he returned sadly to the palace.
sentences.chinese: “我把她给追丢了，”王子伤心地回了王宫。

sentences.english: If I tell you how I lost it you would hate me forever.
sentences.chinese: 如果我告诉你我是怎么弄丢的，你会恨我一辈子的。

sentences.english: I'm terribly sorry. I lost the magazineyou lent me last week.
sentences.chinese: 真对不直，我把你上周借我的杂丢了。

sentences.english: I threw the brick because no one else would stop.
sentences.chinese: 我丢砖块是因为没有人停下来，小男孩儿声泪俱下。

sentences.english: Six light-minded girls are losing their passports and money on their way to Ibiza.
sentences.chinese: 六个头脑简单的女孩在去伊比萨的路上丢了护照和钱。

sentences.english: How did Tieguai Li always lose things?
sentences.chinese: 这铁拐李怎么老丢东西？

sentences.english: I've caused much bother by lossing my ticket.
sentences.chinese: 我因为丢了票引起了很多麻烦。

sentences.english: Yes I lost my pet cat yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，夜儿我的宠物猫丢了。

sentences.english: The orc breaks Valeera's arm and throws her into the corner.
sentences.chinese: 兽人攀折了瓦蕾拉的手臂，并将其丢到了角落里。

sentences.english: The sister cried her eyes out at the loss of her necklace.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐丢了项链以后，哭得死赴活来。

sentences.english: Two new blankets were thrown across the two beds.
sentences.chinese: 两条新毛毯丢在两张床上。

sentences.english: He felt he lost face when his teacher scolded him in front of the class.
sentences.chinese: 当老师当着全体同学的面批评他时他感到面子大丢。

sentences.english: No. 10 ☆T-bag: How about getting us to somewhere cooler, say, Africa?
sentences.chinese: 把我们丢到凉快点的地方往怎么样，比如，非洲？

sentences.english: One was lost right here in Bombay.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个，刚好是在这儿孟买丢的。

sentences.english: She lost a handkerchief edged with blue.
sentences.chinese: 她丢了一块镶蓝边的手绢。

definition: to lose/to throw away/to discard/to cast away
to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with
to discard in the wrong place (cigarette butts etc)/to leave one's things lying around
to put down/to leave behind/to throw or knock down/to abandon or discard
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
